title: Specific Heat - Energy needed to change T

content.question: A block with specific heat <math alttext="385 joules per kilogram kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>385</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext><mo>/(</mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>K</mtext><mo>)</mo></mstyle></math> has an initial temperature of <math alttext="20 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math>. To raise the temperature of the block to <math alttext="40 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math>, <math alttext="3850 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3850</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></math> of energy is required. How much energy would be required to increase the temperature of the block from <math alttext="20 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math> to <math alttext="80 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>80</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math>?
